intro: Bucco hispida, commonly known as the rough-leaved bucco, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
